lines.text: Did you ever ask him who he really was?
No.
Women are supposed to be curious... especially wives.
Press agents are supposed to be curious.
I wasn't married to him.
Except for the ceremony, neither was I.
I'm sorry, Dave, but it hasn't been easy. I didn't mind being a hypocrite. I didn't mind presenting emotion for a man I despised. You hate me for what I said?
No.
He loved me once a long time ago.
How did you know?
Women know these things.
Do they?
Did you?

[Seeing Spring's switchblade knife close to his abdomen]
I thought I was holding YOU!
A man's got to learn to protect himself in today's world. It's really a jungle, you know.
Somewhere we have known we have made tremendous progress.

[Shaving in the bathroom mirror]
What makes you think so?
Because this morning I was ordered to kill you.

[Continuing to shave for a moment and then turning around]
What did you say?
I was ordered to kill you.

the order I received and ignored can be given to others. First you and now we are gambling for very high stakes, and we must be extremely cautious. We must meet cautiously, and we must travel cautiously.
I'm inclined to rely on your judgment in such cases.
The first mark of a talented amateur is that he respects the professional. Au revoir.
Au revoir.

[last lines to Brita]
This is a story of today that began yesterday and will end tomorrow.

[about the sudden death of her husband]
What's going to happen now?
death certificates, funerals, statements to the press... wear something black.
